name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Chester ERB

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Chester ERB.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
The Order of the Superior Court is reversed. 380 Pa.Super. 645, 547 A.2d 436 (1988). We conclude that the trial court did not abuse its discretion in excluding those portions of the victim’s diary which were protected by the Rape Shield Law, 18 Pa.C.S. § 3104. Commonwealth v. Majorana, 503 Pa. 602, 470 A.2d 80 (1983).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: William H. Ryan, Dist. Atty., Sandra L. Elias, Chief, Law & Appeals Unit, Vram Nedurian, Jr., Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellant.
Gaele McLaughlin Barthold, Deputy Dist. Atty., Ronald Eisenberg, Deborah Fleisher, Philadelphia, Chief, Appeals Div., for amicus — Phila. D.A.
Joseph D. Branca, Aston, for appellee.

569 A.2d 352
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Chester ERB.

Gaele McLaughlin Barthold, Deputy Dist. Atty., Ronald Eisenberg, Deborah Fleisher, Philadelphia, Chief, Appeals Div., for amicus — Phila. D.A.
